name: Judah
description: Fourth son of Jacob, ancestor of kings. Suggested selling Joseph instead of killing him — mercy mixed with cruelty. Later transformed: offered himself as slave to save Benjamin. 'Judah, your brothers shall praise you.' The lion's whelp, the scepter that shall not depart.

suggesting-sale.name: What Profit to Kill Him
suggesting-sale.description: Judah proposing to sell Joseph to the Ishmaelites
suggesting-sale.prompt: standing among brothers at the pit - gesturing toward approaching caravan of Ishmaelites. Face showing calculation rather than pure malice. 'What profit if we kill our brother?' Preventing murder, but enabling slavery. The first glimpse of leadership.

at-the-pit.name: Standing Over the Pit
at-the-pit.description: Judah with brothers, Joseph in the pit below
at-the-pit.prompt: standing at edge of dry cistern - Joseph visible below or recently thrown in. Judah's face shows conflict rather than pure hatred. The coat of many colors discarded nearby. Brothers around him. Before the sale, after the stripping.

receiving-silver.name: Twenty Pieces of Silver
receiving-silver.expression: the price of a brother, guilt beginning
receiving-silver.prompt: hand outstretched receiving silver coins from Ishmaelite merchant - Joseph being led away in background. The moment of transaction, brother sold for twenty pieces. Face perhaps beginning to show the weight of what they've done.

pledging-for-benjamin.name: I Will Be Surety
pledging-for-benjamin.description: Judah pledging himself as guarantee for Benjamin
pledging-for-benjamin.prompt: standing before aged Jacob - hand on heart or raised in oath, face showing complete resolve. 'I will be surety for him; from my hand you shall require him.' The man who sold one brother now stakes everything for another.

offering-himself.name: Let Me Remain as Slave
offering-himself.description: Judah's great speech - offering himself instead of Benjamin
offering-himself.prompt: kneeling or standing before Egyptian vizier (Joseph unrecognized) - arms outstretched in supplication, face showing total commitment. 'Let your servant remain instead of the boy as a slave.' The ultimate transformation from one who sold a brother to one who offers himself.

how-face-father.name: How Can I Face My Father
how-face-father.description: Judah's anguished plea about Jacob's grief
how-face-father.prompt: face contorted with anguish - describing what would happen if Benjamin doesn't return. 'How can I go up to my father if the boy is not with me, lest I see the evil that would find my father?' Love for father overwhelming.
how-face-father.energy: desperate love, cannot cause more grief

lions-whelp.name: Lion's Whelp
lions-whelp.description: Judah receiving Jacob's blessing - lion imagery
lions-whelp.prompt: kneeling before dying Jacob receiving blessing - or standing with lion imagery around him. 'Judah is a lion's whelp; from the prey, my son, you have gone up.' Regal bearing, fierce and noble. The tribe of kings.

embracing-joseph.name: Embracing Joseph
embracing-joseph.description: Judah embracing the brother he once sold
embracing-joseph.prompt: embracing Joseph with tears streaming - the brother he sold now forgiven, the vizier revealed as family. Face showing relief, joy, perhaps residual guilt transformed. 'God meant it for good.' Full circle.

rivalry-at-pit.name: Rivalry: At the Pit
rivalry-at-pit.description: Judah among brothers deciding Joseph's fate
rivalry-at-pit.prompt: Judah stands with the brothers above the pit, gesturing toward approaching Ishmaelite caravan. 'What profit if we kill him?' Face showing pragmatic calculation. Joseph's coat of many colors held or discarded. Preventing murder by enabling slavery.
rivalry-at-pit.energy: Betrayal, pragmatic cruelty, beginning of guilt

rivalry-offering-self.name: Rivalry: Offering Himself
rivalry-offering-self.description: Judah offering himself as slave for Benjamin
rivalry-offering-self.prompt: Judah kneeling before Egyptian vizier in desperate supplication - arms outstretched, face showing complete surrender. 'Let me remain instead of the boy as slave to my lord.' The transformation complete — from selling a brother to offering himself.

rivalry-reconciliation.name: Rivalry: Embracing Joseph
rivalry-reconciliation.description: Judah in the moment of reconciliation with Joseph
rivalry-reconciliation.prompt: Judah embracing Joseph, or falling before him weeping. The brother he sold, now revealed as their savior. Tears of relief and joy mixing with years of guilt finally released. Family restored, sin forgiven.
